Stem: People who work from home report higher job satisfaction, on average, than those who work in an office. Give one reason why this might be true, other than working from home causing higher job satisfaction.

RunsThroughA.text: Working from home eliminates the stress of commuting, which increases job satisfaction.
RunsThroughA.explanation: This is A->Mediator->B. Reduced commute stress (Mediator) is a direct result of WFH (A).

RunsThroughA.text: WFH allows for better work-life balance, making employees happier with their jobs.
RunsThroughA.explanation: This is A->B. Work-life balance is the mechanism by which WFH increases satisfaction.

RunsThroughA.text: People are more focused and productive at home because there are fewer distractions, which leads to higher satisfaction.
RunsThroughA.explanation: This is A->Mediator->B. Increased focus/fewer distractions (Mediator) is caused by WFH (A).
